Which body part should you be careful for the most?
=====================================  

```{r global, include=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# load data in 'global' chunk so it can be shared by all users of the dashboard
library(tidyverse)
library(flexdashboard)
library(dplyr)
library(plotly)
library(stringr)
library(devtools)
install_github("josedv82/bdgramR")
library(bdgramR)

shark <- read.csv("Shark Dataset.csv")

```

Column {.sidebar}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

```{r}
selectInput("injured_EL", label = "Which part of your body do you want to watch out for?", 
            choices =  c("Arms" = "arms",
                         "Legs" = "legs"))


```

Data source: Australian Shark-Incident Database

Row
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
### plot

unfortunately this body part polygon doesn't work with plotly so i haven't figured out a way to combine it with plotly. i plan to clean the data from the shark dataset and add it to the body though

```{r}
renderPlot({
dat <- bdgramr(data = data, model = "basic_male")

ggplot(data = dat, aes(x,y, group = Id)) +
  geom_bdgramr(color = "cyan", aes(fill = Muscle)) +
  labs(title = "BdygramR: original_male diagram")

})
```
